user-story.i-want: the site to adapt to my screen size
user-story.so-that: I have an optimal browsing experience on mobile, tablet, or desktop

criterion.description: Product grid adapts seamlessly across all viewports: Mobile (< 640px): 1 column layout with full-width cards, Tablet (640-1023px): 2-3 columns with appropriate gap spacing, Desktop (1024px+): 3-4 columns with optimal viewing density

All UI elements meet minimum touch target requirements: Minimum 44x44 pixels for all interactive elements (WCAG 2.1 AA), Buttons, links, form controls, and clickable cards, Adequate spacing between touch targets (8px minimum)
Navigation adapts to viewport size: Mobile: Hamburger menu (â˜°) replaces full navigation bar, Desktop: Full horizontal navigation visible, Smooth transitions between collapsed/expanded states

Filters are accessible on all devices: Mobile: Slide-out drawer or bottom sheet with "Filters" button, Tablet: Optional drawer or sidebar toggle, Desktop: Fixed sidebar always visible (240-280px width), All filter sections functional across viewports

Images maintain aspect ratio and quality: Responsive images using Next.js Image component, No distortion or stretching at any viewport, Proper lazy loading with placeholder skeletons, Support for WebP with fallback formats

Typography scales appropriately: Readable font sizes at all breakpoints (minimum 16px body text), Proper line heights for readability, Headings scale proportionally with clamp() or breakpoint-based sizing
Site tested across full viewport range: Minimum: 320px (iPhone SE), Maximum: 2560px (large desktop displays), Key breakpoints: 375px, 640px, 768px, 1024px, 1280px, 1536px
No horizontal scrolling on any viewport: Container max-widths prevent overflow, All content constrained to viewport width, Proper overflow-x handling

doc.title: Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: The site shall provide a fully functional mobile experience with touch-optimized interactions. All features shall be accessible and usable on devices with screen widths from 320px to 2560px. Mobile users shall represent the primary design consideration given typical e-commerce traffic patterns.

doc.title: Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: The design shall represent a modern, premium aesthetic that exceeds the visual quality of enthusiastauto.com. The site shall maintain brand consistency with enthusiastauto.com while establishing its own refined identity. All UI components shall maintain a cohesive design system.

doc.title: Epic Breakdown
doc.snippet: Complete acceptance criteria, 5 story points, technical notes. Use CSS Grid or Flexbox with breakpoints. Mobile-first design approach. Consider using ShadCN responsive utilities.

doc.title: UX/UI Specification
doc.snippet: Complete breakpoint system (320px, 375px, 640px, 768px, 1024px, 1280px, 1536px), adaptation patterns for product grid/navigation/filter panel, touch target requirements (44x44px minimum per WCAG 2.1 AA).

doc.title: UX/UI Specification
doc.snippet: Mobile-first strategy: Base styles for mobile (320px), progressive enhancement with min-width media queries. Breakpoints: sm (640px), md (768px), lg (1024px), xl (1280px), 2xl (1536px).

doc.title: UX/UI Specification
doc.snippet: Product grid: 1 col mobile, 2-3 col tablet, 3-4 col desktop. Navigation: hamburger menu mobile, full nav desktop. Filter panel: slide-out drawer mobile, fixed sidebar desktop.

doc.title: UX/UI Specification
doc.snippet: Touch targets: Minimum 44x44 pixels (WCAG 2.1 AA), 8px spacing between targets. Zoom/scaling: Allow pinch-to-zoom, text reflow at 200% zoom without horizontal scroll. Orientation: Support both portrait and landscape.

doc.title: Architecture Documentation
doc.snippet: Tailwind CSS 4.0.14 for utility-first styling, Next.js 15.3.0 with App Router for SSR, React 19 with Server Components.

doc.snippet: Server Components default for static content, Client Components ('use client') for interactivity. Hybrid rendering model with SSR and ISR.

constraints.constraint: Next.js 15 App Router pattern: All pages use app/ directory with Server Components by default. Add 'use client' directive only for interactive components (mobile menu, filter drawer).
Mobile-First Approach: Start with mobile layouts (320px base) and progressively enhance for larger viewports using min-width media queries (Tailwind sm:, md:, lg: prefixes).

WCAG 2.1 Level AA Compliance: All interactive elements must have minimum 44x44px touch targets on mobile. Adequate spacing (8px min) between touch targets. Color contrast ratios must meet 4.5:1 for normal text.
Server Components for Static Content: Navigation structure and filter panel layout should be Server Components. Only mobile menu toggle and drawer open/close interactions need 'use client'.
Tailwind CSS Grid: Use Tailwind's grid utilities with responsive column counts: grid grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3 xl:grid-cols-4 gap-4 md:gap-6
HeadlessUI Dialog Pattern: Use HeadlessUI Dialog component for mobile menu and filter drawer. Provides built-in accessibility (focus trap, backdrop, ESC key handling).
Next.js Image Optimization: Always use Next.js Image component for responsive images. Supports automatic WebP format, lazy loading, and responsive sizing.

Container Max-Widths: Use Tailwind container class with max-width constraints to prevent overflow: max-w-screen-sm (640px), max-w-screen-md (768px), max-w-screen-lg (1024px), max-w-screen-xl (1280px), max-w-screen-2xl (1536px).
No Horizontal Scrolling: Set overflow-x: hidden on html/body elements. Ensure all content respects viewport width with max-w and responsive utilities.
Typography Scale: Base font size 16px (1rem). Use Tailwind text-* utilities with responsive breakpoints or CSS clamp() for fluid typography. Line heights: 1.5 for body, 1.25 for headings.
Breakpoint Testing: Test at specific viewports - 320px (iPhone SE), 375px (iPhone 12), 390px (iPhone 13), 768px (iPad Mini), 1024px (iPad Pro), 1280px (MacBook), 1920px (iMac).
Performance Targets: Lighthouse mobile performance score 85+, desktop 90+. Optimize with Next.js Image lazy loading, Tailwind CSS purge, and minimal JavaScript bundle for Server Components.
TypeScript Strict Mode: All code must pass TypeScript strict type checking. No 'any' types unless absolutely necessary with justification.
Prettier Formatting: All code must be formatted with Prettier before commit. Run 'pnpm prettier:fix' to format.

Template Responsiveness: Next.js Commerce template already has some responsive design. This story AUDITS and ENHANCES existing patterns rather than rebuilding from scratch. DO NOT remove existing responsive utilities unless they conflict with requirements.

standards.description: Testing follows Next.js and React testing best practices. Unit tests use Jest/Vitest. Component tests use React Testing Library. E2E tests use Playwright (not yet implemented). Responsive testing uses browser DevTools responsive mode + real device testing. Accessibility testing uses Lighthouse audit (target 90+ score) and axe DevTools. Performance testing uses Lighthouse (mobile 85+, desktop 90+).

idea.description: Test product grid responsive columns: Verify grid has 1 column at 320px, 2 columns at 640px, 3 columns at 1024px, 4 columns at 1280px. Use browser DevTools responsive mode.
Test grid gap spacing: Verify gap-4 (16px) on mobile, gap-6 (24px) on desktop. Measure with browser inspector.
Test responsive images: Verify Next.js Image component loads correct sizes at different viewports. Check Network tab for image formats (WebP with fallback).
Audit touch targets: Measure all interactive elements (buttons, links, form controls) with browser inspector. Verify minimum 44x44px on mobile viewports (< 768px).
Test touch target spacing: Verify 8px minimum spacing between interactive elements. Measure with browser inspector or accessibility tools.
Test on real mobile devices: Open site on iOS Safari and Chrome Android. Verify all buttons are easily tappable without accidental double-taps.
Test navigation toggle: Verify full navigation visible at >= 768px, hamburger menu visible at < 768px. Test breakpoint transition at exactly 768px.
Test mobile menu: Click hamburger icon, verify menu slides in with 300ms animation. Test backdrop click-to-close, ESC key close, and navigation link clicks.
Test keyboard navigation: Tab through menu items, verify focus indicators visible. Test Enter/Space to activate links.
Test filter drawer mobile: Verify "Filters" button visible at < 1024px. Click to open drawer, verify slide-in animation, maintain filter state, close with backdrop/ESC.
Test filter sidebar desktop: Verify fixed sidebar visible at >= 1024px with 240-280px width. Test sticky position on scroll.
Test filter state persistence: Apply filters, open/close drawer, verify selections persist. Test across page navigation.
Test image aspect ratios: Verify product images maintain aspect ratio at all viewports (no squashing/stretching). Test with DevTools responsive mode.
Test lazy loading: Scroll down product grid, verify images load progressively. Check Network tab for lazy-loaded image requests.
Test image formats: Verify WebP images served with fallback to PNG/JPG. Check Network tab for image response headers and formats.
Test typography scale: Verify base font size 16px (1rem) on body text. Test heading sizes (H1-H6) scale proportionally at different breakpoints.
Test line heights: Verify line-height 1.5 (150%) for body text, 1.25 (125%) for headings. Measure with browser inspector.
Test text contrast: Run axe DevTools to verify color contrast ratios meet WCAG AA (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text).
Test iPhone SE (320px): Smallest viewport target. Verify all content visible, no horizontal scroll, touch targets adequate.
Test standard smartphones (375px, 390px, 412px): Verify layout looks good on common phone sizes. Test on real devices if available.
Test tablets (768px, 810px, 1024px): Verify breakpoint transitions smooth, 2-3 column grid, navigation/filters accessible.
Test desktop (1280px, 1440px, 1920px): Verify 3-4 column grid, full navigation visible, fixed filter sidebar, no wasted space.
Test large displays (2560px+): Verify layout doesn't stretch excessively, container max-widths prevent content from spanning too wide.
Test horizontal scrolling: Open DevTools responsive mode, test all breakpoints (320px-2560px). Verify no horizontal scrollbar appears at any viewport.
Test zoom functionality: Zoom browser to 200% at various viewports. Verify text reflows without horizontal scrolling. Test with Cmd/Ctrl + "+"/"-" or browser zoom menu.
Test container constraints: Verify Tailwind container class or custom max-w utilities applied. Inspect with DevTools to check max-width values match expected breakpoints.
Run Lighthouse mobile audit: Target performance 85+, accessibility 90+, best practices 90+, SEO 90+. Fix any critical issues flagged.
Run Lighthouse desktop audit: Target performance 90+, accessibility 90+. Desktop typically scores higher than mobile.
Test build and TypeScript: Run 'pnpm build', verify no TypeScript errors, no build warnings. Check bundle size with 'pnpm analyze' if available.
Run Prettier check: Execute 'pnpm prettier:check', verify no formatting issues. Run 'pnpm prettier:fix' if needed before commit.
